alert.note: Alert for Marion; Ralls (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Tornado Warning issued March 31 at 4:02PM CDT until March 31 at 4:45PM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: The National Weather Service in St Louis has issued a * Tornado Warning for... Northwestern Pike County in west central Illinois... Southeastern Adams County in west central Illinois... Northeastern Ralls County in northeastern Missouri... Southeastern Marion County in northeastern Missouri... * Until 445 PM CDT. * At 402 PM CDT, a severe thunderstorm capable of producing a tornado was located near Hannibal, moving east at 65 mph. HAZARD...Tornado and baseball size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated rotation. Spotters report base ball size hail near Renssellaer. IMPACT...Flying debris will be dangerous to those caught without shelter. Mobile homes will be damaged or destroyed. Damage to roofs, windows, and vehicles will occur. Tree damage is likely. * This dangerous storm will be near... Fall Creek around 410 PM CDT. Payson around 415 PM CDT. Barry around 420 PM CDT. Other locations in the path of this tornadic thunderstorm include Beverly. This includes the following highways... Interstate 172 near exit 2. Interstate 72 between exits 4 and 20. TORNADO...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...2.75 IN
info.instruction: TAKE COVER NOW! Move to a basement or an interior room on the lowest floor of a sturdy building. Avoid windows. If you are outdoors, in a mobile home, or in a vehicle, move to the closest substantial shelter and protect yourself from flying debris.
